name: One window is enough
description:
From collection: "inside: shadows"

When my trust hung from the loose rope of justice
And all over the city
The hearts of my lights were shattered
When They tied my childish eyes of my love 
with a dark handkerchief of the law
And from the anxious migraines of my desire
Fountains of blood splashed out
When My Life was Nothing
but a ticking wall clock

I realized I have to, have to,
have to love crazy

One window is enough for me ...
A window to the moment of awareness and gaze and silence…

Forough Farrokhzad
